intro: Microcharis cufodontii, commonly known as the Cufodontii nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine, pubescent texture. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
